str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From ana and phero; to take up.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering. From thuo; sacrifice.
Praise, commendation. From aineo; a praising, i.e. a thank(-offering).
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.
From a form of the same as chasma; a lip; figuratively, a margin.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From a compound of the base of homou and logos; to assent, i.e. Covenant, acknowledge.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
